description: The fight for reproductive rights, a key pillar for Democrats, has shifted politically to the states.
title: More Than 2 Million Voters Backed Both Trump and Abortion Access

description: After announcing what’s widely expected to be a quarter-point cut in interest rates, the Fed will have to reassure markets it can manage the impact of a president-elect who's vowed a raft of new tariffs and tax cuts.
title: Jerome Powell Is Back in Trump’s World and About to Feel the Heat

description: While many states were more or less as tight as the polls suggested, the errors were all in the same direction: underestimating Trump.
title: What Looked Like a Toss-Up Turned Into a Red Wave. Did Pollsters Get It Wrong?

description: European Union countries are discussing a joint air shield that would cost around €500 billion ($537 billion), the bloc’s nominee for defense commissioner, Andrius Kubilius, told the European Parliament.
title: EU’s New Defense Chief Says Air Shield May Cost €500 Billion

description: South American beef suppliers stand to benefit if Donald Trump’s promises for US tariffs against China end up resulting in a major trade dispute between the nations.
title: Minerva Says South America Set to Benefit From US-China Tensions

description: Vice President Kamala Harris told supporters to accept her election loss at the hands of President-elect Donald Trump but urged them to keep fighting for the ideals she espoused in her campaign as she publicly conceded the 2024 presidential race.
title: Harris Concedes to Trump, Urges Allies to Fight for Their Ideals

description: Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney. Donald Trump has won the presidential election and his victory is reverberating across global markets...Today’s must-reads:• Trump victorious • How the election result is roiling markets• NAB profit meets expectations
title: Trump's Return to the White House

description: Donald Trump said he could win New York. He didn’t, but his home state did shift right — helping him potentially win the American popular vote.
title: Donald Trump Lost in New York, But He Is Slowly Winning It Over

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics and influence reporter Ted Mann looks at what Trump’s broad victory means going forward.
title: Trump Propels the Country to the Right With Broad-Based Victory

description: The special counsel overseeing the federal criminal cases against Donald Trump is preparing to drop the prosecutions of the president-elect before he is sworn in, according to a Justice Department official.
title: DOJ Set to Drop Federal Cases Against Trump Before Inauguration

description: Pirelli & C. SpA’s largest investor, Sinochem International Corp., is under review for a potential breach of a local government rule aimed at limiting China’s influence over strategically important assets.
title: Pirelli’s Top Investor Faces Probe on Possible China-Rule Breach

description: US Representative Elissa Slotkin of Michigan was elected senator, narrowly defeating Republican Mike Rogers and keeping the seat in the hands of Democrats.
title: Slotkin Elected Senator in Michigan, Keeping Seat for Democrats

description: An hour after polls closed in North Carolina on Tuesday night, Democrats in the downtown Raleigh Marriott described competing emotions as they swayed under arches of blue balloons to the Black Eyed Peas playing in the background.
title: Nauseous Optimism for Democrats Turns to Despair After Trump Win

description: The alarm from economists has been clear for months: Brace yourself. If he delivers on his campaign promises for an aggressive package of new US tariffs, they’ve warned, a re-elected Donald Trump will set the stage for a historic period of turmoil in the global economy.
title: More Trump Tariffs Are Coming But CEOs Insist They Are Prepared

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz called for a confidence vote on Jan. 15 and said he wants a snap election by the end of March.
title: Scholz Calls for Snap Vote in Germany After Firing Finance Chief

description: Trump’s relationships with world leaders will shape global events but they’ve also laid bare many unknowns
title: World Leaders: Who Wins and Who Loses From Trump’s Return

description: Illinois voters approved a nonbinding proposal to add an extra 3% levy on annual incomes of more than $1 million, which could fuel a new effort to raise taxes on the state’s highest earners.
title: Millionaire Tax Backed by Illinois Voters in Threat to Chicago

description: State and city outcomes will shape the direction of US policy on criminal justice, voting and drug policy.
title: Key Ballot Initiatives and Local Races Highlight Views on Abortion, Immigration

description: Donald Trump’s impending return to the White House has brought Iran’s booming oil flows back into focus — as well as the possibility that the president-elect will once again try to crush them.
title: Iran’s Booming Oil Flow Under Scrutiny After Trump Win

description: Ireland will hold an early general election as Prime Minister Simon Harris takes advantage of favorable poll numbers and a slump in support for Sinn Fein, the main opposition party, which is mired in a series of scandals.
title: Ireland’s PM Announces Early Election to Pounce on Poll Lead

description: Kamala Harris has called Donald Trump to concede the election to the President-elect, a senior aide to the Vice President told Bloomberg.
title: Harris Has Called Trump to Concede Election

description: For the second time in eight years, a woman has been unable to break the ultimate glass ceiling: the US presidency.
title: Harris’ Defeat Keeps a 248-Year Barrier for American Women Intact

description: Incumbent Democrat Tammy Baldwin defeated Republican Eric Hovde in the Wisconsin Senate race, according to AP.
title: Baldwin Wins Wisconsin Senate Race, Democrats Hold Seat

description: Companies including BP, Amazon and Microsoft joined with environmental groups to defeat a proposal to end the state’s cap-and-trade program.
title: Washington State Votes to Keep Carbon Tax That Was Up for Repeal

description: The next general election in Ireland will be held on November 29, Irish premier Simon Harris has said.
title: Irish General Election Date Confirmed for November 29

description: The election of Donald Trump as the next US president raises risks and uncertainty for the global economy and should encourage Europe to address its weaknesses, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.
title: ECB’s Villeroy Says Trump Election Poses Risks to Global Economy

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ top official rejected the suggestion that Treasury civil servants broke the law by withholding information about a multi-billion-pound black hole in the public finances from the government’s fiscal watchdog, but conceded they did breach a code of conduct.
title: Top UK Treasury Official Rejects Suggestion Department Broke Law

description: Rohit Chopra’s crackdowns on illegal car repossessions, home foreclosures and bank overdraft fees made him a hero to consumer groups and a foe of lenders.
title: Donald Trump Has Tools to Fire Powerful Financial Regulator in Term Two

description: Donald Trump is set to return to the White House in a political comeback for the ages. That reality, following the defeat of Vice President Kamala Harris, is forcing the Democratic Party — and its progressive and moderate wings — to once again reassess its future.
title: Democrats Again Examine Their Fate After Second Loss to Trump

description: Republican Donald Trump won the battleground state of Michigan and its 15 electoral votes, according to the Associated Press.
title: Trump Wins State of Michigan

description: Many people involved in crypto markets had reason to gloat on Wednesday about Donald Trump’s win, but one closely watched French trader’s bets are poised to pay out millions of dollars on the election’s outcome.
title: Polymarket’s French Whale Scores a $48 Million Trump Jackpot

description: The sustainability of the dollar’s surge in the wake of Donald Trump’s election victory pivots on which of his campaign promises he pursues once back in the White House.
title: Dollar’s Election-Fueled Surge Worsens Trump’s Currency Problem

description: Senator Mitch McConnell set up potential clashes with Donald Trump and his isolationist allies over Ukraine and other foreign policy matters even as he congratulated the president-elect on reclaiming the White House.
title: McConnell Signals He’ll Be Speed Bump to Trump Isolationism

description: Mexicans should remain calm in the wake of Donald Trump’s decisive election win, the president of the US’s largest trading partner and southern neighbor said, sounding a note of pragmatism as local markets began to recover from their initial shock.
title: Sheinbaum Urges Calm, Meets Larry Fink as Mexican Selloff Fades

description: Donald Trump’s reelection promises another shakeup for American agriculture.
title: Trump’s Return Set to Upend Trade for American Farmers Yet Again

description: Israel sees Donald Trump’s dramatic US election victory as freeing its hand to press on with the wars against Hamas and Hezbollah and even contemplate strikes aimed at disabling Iran’s nuclear program.
title: Trump’s Return Gives Israel a Gap to Derail Iran’s Nuclear Plans

description: Donald Trump has repeatedly told associates in Britain he thinks the country’s new Prime Minister Keir Starmer is “very left-wing,” underscoring how traditionally close relations between the US and UK are likely to be strained by the Republican president-elect’s victory on Tuesday.
title: Trump Comeback Traps UK’s Starmer in Uncomfortable Relationship

description: Betting websites that allow wagers on political outcomes had the former president as a heavy favorite leading into Tuesday’s vote, even as traditional polls showed a razor-thin margin.
title: Trump Win Boosts Prediction Markets That Nailed Election Outcome

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his cabinet ministers tried to calm fears that US President-Elect Donald Trump will wreak havoc on trade and potentially devastate Canada’s export-driven economy.
title: Trudeau Tries to Reassure ‘Anxious’ Canadians on Trump’s Return

description: President Claudia Sheinbaum unveiled her vision for Mexico’s energy sector, promising to increase funding for power generation and transmission projects and streamline rules for private investors.
title: Mexico’s $23.4 Billion Energy Plan Aims to Woo Private Investors

description: Massachusetts voters backed the elimination of the state’s standardized test as a high school graduation requirement, despite warnings from business leaders and Governor Maura Healey that the move would undermine its top-tier education system.
title: Massachusetts Voters Back Push to Overturn High School Exit Exam

description: Trump’s reelection — a political comeback for the ages — is about to test the limits of American democracy.
title: What Trump’s Win Means for the MAGA Movement

description: Ukraine said a drone strike hit a naval base in a port city on Russia’s Caspian Sea coast, in Kyiv’s first-ever attack on a target in the region some 1,500 kilometers (930 miles) from the frontline.
title: Ukraine Says Drone Strike Hits Port in First Caspian Sea Attack

description: Donald Trump is headed back to the White House, vowing to upend relations with allies and enemies alike and facing few of the constraints that limited his “America first” push last time.
title: Trump’s Return Looks to Upend US Foreign Policy Once Again

description: Mozambique’s Maputo port, a key chrome export hub, has stopped receiving cargo due to ongoing election unrest in the southeast African nation.
title: Mozambique’s Main Port Halts Taking Cargo After Election Unrest

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s shock firing of his defense chief on Tuesday night removed a cabinet critic, but also deepened anger among opponents about his handling of the country’s multi-front conflict.
title: Netanyahu’s Firing of Israel Defense Chief Gallant Draws Ire and Praise

description: The country that’s the biggest buyer of US goods and its largest external oil supplier is bracing for economic disruption now that voters have returned Donald Trump to the White House.
title: Trump Sweep Creates New Fight for Trudeau as Trade Talks Loom

description: ‘America First’ is here to stay, and Europeans haven't done enough to prepare for it.
title: Trump's Euro Allies Are Defenseless Against MAGA

description: A risk-on frenzy enveloped financial assets early Wednesday as Donald Trump clinched the White House for a second term, decisively winning what had been seen as a neck-and-neck race against Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Wall Street Reacts: It’s Full Risk-On as Trump Scores Win

description: Puerto Rico’s Jenniffer Gonzalez-Colon, a Donald Trump supporter and lifelong Republican, is leading the race for governor, bucking an attempt by superstar Bad Bunny to sway the vote against her.
title: Puerto Rico’s Ruling Party Holds Lead, Fending Off Bad Bunny

description: Switzerland said it still hasn’t reached an agreement with the European Union on some key parts of a proposed new deal with the bloc, pushing talks closer to a year-end deadline both sides would like to meet.
title: Swiss Push on With EU Talks as Year-End Deadline Looms

description: The world digested the return of Donald Trump to the White House with a sense of shock and trepidation.
title: Stunned World Braces for Sudden Realignment After Trump’s Return

description: No billionaire did more to help Donald Trump win the US presidential election than Elon Musk. The Tesla Inc. and SpaceX boss will now find out whether it pays off or he ends up getting burned.
title: Musk Is About to Find Out What $130 Million for Trump Gets Him

description: Mozambique’s top court ordered the electoral authority to clarify discrepancies in last month’s election results, amid growing anti-government protests that are set to culminate in a march in the capital Maputo on Thursday.
title: Mozambique Court Orders Vote Body to Clarify Election Results

description: Today on the Big Take: Donald Trump has been elected the 47th president of the United States. The so-called Trump Trade is surging. What’s next?
title: Election Night Ends With Trump Victory, Surging Markets

description: Donald Trump’s victory in Tuesday’s presidential contest injects deep uncertainties into the US economic outlook that could alter the Federal Reserve’s policy calculus in the months ahead, while renewing questions about how fiercely he might pressure the central bank during his second term in the White House.
title: Trump Victory Raises Big Uncertainties for the Federal Reserve

description: Investors bracing for President Donald Trump 2.0 know two things: The new administration will seek to ram through his “Make America Great Again” agenda, and the ensuing bill could be sky-high.
title: In Trump Markets, Big Question Is How Much ‘MAGA’ 2.0 Will Cost

description: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te is considering trying to call Donald Trump after the former US president recaptured the White House, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Taiwan’s Leader Considers Calling Trump After Election Victory

description: France’s government confirmed it expects the budget deficit to rise to 6.1% of economic output in 2024 as it canceled some spending plans to mitigate part of the huge impact from unexpectedly weak tax revenues.
title: France Confirms 2024 Budget Deficit Seen at 6.1% of GDP

description: Crypto advocates took a victory lap on Wednesday as the vast amounts of money they poured into the US elections yielded huge dividends, from Donald Trump’s reelection to down-ballot wins for politicians friendly to the sector.
title: ‘A New American Renaissance:’ Crypto Celebrates Trump’s Return

description: Kenya’s economy is on the mend and the country is unlikely to need further assistance from the International Monetary Fund, according to the head of President William Ruto’s economic council.
title: Kenyan Leader’s Economic Adviser Cautions Against More IMF Aid

description: Thailand will explore offering fresh incentives to attract global companies looking to minimize the hit from the US-China trade war that’s likely to intensify in the wake of Donald Trump’s presidential election win, according to the country’s commerce minister.
title: Thailand Readies Incentives to Win From Trade War in Trump Era

description: When Donald Trump first started a trade war with China in 2018, Beijing found itself on the back foot and unsure of how to respond. This time President Xi Jinping is better prepared for a fight, even as he has more to lose.
title: Xi Is Better Prepared for Trump Even as 60% Tariffs Risk Chaos

description: The decisive victory shows Trump’s first term was no aberration. Now, he takes the White House fully schooled in the levers of executive power — and with more leeway to govern as he pleases.
title: Trump’s Populism Is Unleashed After Resounding White House Comeback

description: Republican Tim Sheehy, a former Navy SEAL and the founder of an aerospace company, ousted Democrat Jon Tester in the Montana Senate race, according to AP.
title: Tester Ousted in Montana Senate Race; Republicans Pick Up Seat

description: Donald Trump is returning to the White House, and the US economy is in for a wild ride.
title: Trump to Reshape US Economy With Tariffs, Crackdown on Migrants

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here. Readers of the Washington Edition newsletter are also receiving this special edition on the US election.
title: The Scale of Donald Trump’s Victory Was the Real Shock

description: House Republican Jen Kiggans fended off a challenge from Democrat Missy Cotter Smasal to win reelection in Virginia’s 2nd Congressional District, according to CNN and ABC.
title: GOP’s Kiggans Wins Virginia House Race, Fends Off Challenger

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Donald Trump’s “peace through strength approach” to global relations could help end Russia’s war on his country.
title: Zelenskiy Says Trump’s ‘Strength’ Can Bring End to Russia’s War

description: Donald Trump was elected the 47th president of the United States, pulling off a stunning political comeback in one of the most polarized contests for the White House in US history.
title: Trump Wins US Presidential Election in Extraordinary Comeback

description: Two pilots were missing after a military aircraft crashed during training in Vietnam’s south central coastal province of Binh Dinh on Wednesday, VnExpress news website reported, citing information from the Ministry of National Defence.
title: Vietnam Military Jet Crashes in Training, Pilots Missing, Report Says

description: Democrat Kristen McDonald Rivet won Michigan’s 8th Congressional District, according to CNN and ABC, defeating Republican Paul Junge.
title: McDonald Rivet Wins Michigan House Race; Democrats Hold Seat

description: Tesla Inc. shares climbed in early trading as investors wager the carmaker run by Elon Musk will be a major beneficiary of Republican nominee Donald Trump nearing a second election to the White House.
title: Tesla Soars as Musk’s All-In Bet on Trump Seen Reaping Rewards

description: World leaders congratulated Donald Trump as he declared victory in the US election, capping one of the most tumultuous campaigns in modern political history to defeat his Democratic challenger Kamala Harris.
title: Trump Congratulated by World Leaders as he Nears White House Win

description: Republican Bernie Moreno unseated the incumbent Democrat in Ohio’s senate race, a major win for crypto companies that had funneled millions of dollars into his campaign.
title: Crypto’s Millions Yield a Win as Moreno Takes Ohio Senate Race

description: Democrats’ best hope for power in Washington as Donald Trump closes in on the White House hinges on the outcome of a handful of fiercely competitive US House races.
title: US House Is Democrats’ Best Hope in Brutal Election for Party

description: Russia’s upper house of parliament ratified a mutual-defense pact with North Korea, amid US and European alarm over Pyongyang’s support for President Vladimir Putin’s war on Ukraine.
title: Russian Senators Ratify Putin’s Defense Pact With North Korea

description: Nigerian Chief of Army Staff Taoreed Lagbaja has died following a period of illness, the presidency said.
title: Nigerian Army Chief Taoreed Lagbaja Dies Following Illness

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Readers of the Balance of Power newsletter are also receiving this special edition in which politics and influence reporter Ted Mann reveals what Election Day looked like in the hottest presidential battleground of 2024, Pennsylvania.
title: Battleground Pennsylvania Opens Trump’s Path to White House

description: Republican Mike Lawler won reelection in New York’s 17th Congressional District, according to ABC and NBC.
title: GOP’s Lawler Wins Reelection in NY House Race, Defeats Jones

description: Republican Tom Barrett won the election in Michigan’s 7th Congressional District, according to ABC and NBC.
title: Barrett Wins Michigan House Race; Republicans Gain Seat

description: Republican Donald Trump won Pennsylvania and its 19 electoral votes, Fox and NBC said.
title: Trump Wins Pennsylvania, Key Battleground State

description: Republican Donald Trump won Maine’s 2nd Congressional District, according to the Associated Press, picking up one electoral vote.
title: Trump Wins Maine’s 2nd Congressional District

description: Democrat Josh Riley defeated incumbent Republican Marc Molinaro in New York’s 19th Congressional District, flipping party control of the US House seat, according to the Associated Press.
title: Republican Molinaro Ousted in NY House Race, Democrats Gain Seat

description: California voters rolled back key elements of the state’s landmark criminal justice reform, according to the Associated Press, reflecting mounting frustration over brazen retail thefts and open-air drug use.
title: California Passes Tough-on-Crime Measure Backed by Big Retailers

description: One of Japan’s biggest union groups plans to seek wage increases of another 6% in next year’s pay negotiations, highlighting sustained pressure on employers to raise pay.
title: Japan’s UA Zensen Union Aims for Continued 6% Wage Hike in 2025

description: Kamala Harris will not speak at Howard University tonight but will address her supporters and “the nation” on Wednesday morning, her campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond told supporters gathered at the vice-president’s alma mater.
title: Harris Campaign Co-Chair Confirms Harris Won’t Speak Tonight

description: Rob Bresnahan won the House race for Pennsylvania’s 8th Congressional District, according to NBC and ABC, ousting Democrat Matt Cartwright.
title: Bresnahan Wins Pennsylvania House Race, Flipping Seat to GOP

description: Republican Donald Trump won Georgia and its 16 electoral votes, according to NBC and CNN.
title: Trump Wins Georgia, Key Battleground State

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz has tried hard in recent days to convince German voters his fractious ruling coalition is still functional. His meeting with the three-party alliance’s top officials on Wednesday evening could determine whether the government can see out its four-year term.
title: Scholz’s Alliance Fights for Survival and Waits on US Election

description: Democrat Kamala Harris won Nebraska’s 2nd Congressional District to net one of the Republican-leaning state’s five electoral votes, according to the Associated Press.
title: Harris Wins Nebraska’s 2nd District for One Electoral Vote

description: Republicans won control of the US Senate amid a slew of victories by allies of Donald Trump, giving the GOP powerful leverage in high-stakes tax and spending battles next year.
title: Republicans Win Control of US Senate Ahead of Critical Tax Fight

description: Republican incumbent Deb Fischer beat back a challenge from independent Dan Osborn to win reelection to her Nebraska Senate seat, according to the Associated Press.
title: GOP’s Fischer Wins Reelection in Nebraska Senate Race

description: Republican Tom Kean Jr. won reelection in New Jersey’s 7th Congressional District, according to the Associated Press.
title: Kean Wins House Race in New Jersey; Republicans Hold Seat

description: Poland is likely to extend an interest-rate pause amid quickening inflation and a widening budget deficit as investors await fresh central bank guidance on when easing may begin.
title: Polish Inflation, Budget Deficit Keep Interest Rates on Hold: Decision Guide

description: Republican Nick LaLota won reelection in New York’s 1st Congressional District, according to CNN and ABC.
title: LaLota Wins House Race in New York; Republicans Hold Seat

description: Republican Donald Trump won the battleground state of North Carolina and its 16 electoral votes, according to the Associated Press.
title: Trump Wins Battleground State of North Carolina

description: Republican car dealer and blockchain entrepreneur Bernie Moreno defeated Senate Banking Chairman Sherrod Brown in Ohio, ousting the Democratic party’s most prominent populist and putting the GOP on course toward a Senate majority.
title: Sherrod Brown Ousted in Ohio as Republicans Flip Senate Seat

description: Democrat Adam Schiff defeated Republican Steve Garvey, a former professional baseball player, in the California Senate race, according to the Associated Press.
title: Democrat Schiff Wins California Senate Race, Defeats Garvey

description: Elon Musk vowed Tuesday to keep his political action committee going beyond the presidential election, a sign the world’s richest person is building a political machine that goes beyond his support of Republican nominee Donald Trump.
title: Musk Vows to Keep His America PAC Going for Midterms, DA Races

description: As the sun set over Manhattan on Tuesday, the lights of the Empire State Building began to glow red, white and blue.
title: New York City, Trump’s Elusive Prize, Hunkers Down as Polls Shut

description: Two Black women, Angela Alsobrooks and Lisa Blunt Rochester, have won US Senate seats representing Maryland and Delaware, breaking another barrier in a 235-year-old institution long dominated by White men.
title: Black Women Break a Barrier in US Senate, Winning Two Seats

description: Democrat Angela Alsobrooks defeated Republican Larry Hogan in the Maryland Senate race, according to the Associated Press, holding on to a seat Republicans hoped they could flip.
title: Alsobrooks Wins Maryland Senate Race; Democrats Hold Seat

description: The Philippines has approved the purchase of 40 fast patrol craft worth 25.8 billion pesos ($441 million), seeking to bolster maritime security as tensions with Beijing in the South China Sea linger.
title: Philippines Approves Purchase of 40 Patrol Boats Amid China Spat

description: Republican Donald Trump won Texas and its 40 electoral votes, according to CNN and Fox.
title: Trump Wins Texas, State He Carried in Both 2016 and 2020

description: Democrat Kamala Harris won New York and its 28 electoral votes, according to the Associated Press.
title: Harris Wins New York

description: Florida voters rejected a ballot measure to legalize recreational marijuana, dealing a blow to the cannabis industry and giving a win to the leading opponents: Governor Ron DeSantis and billionaire Ken Griffin.
title: Legal Weed Fails in Florida in Victory for DeSantis, Griffin

description: North Carolina Democrat Josh Stein defeated Republican Mark Robinson in the election for governor, according to Fox and NBC.
title: Democrat Stein Wins North Carolina Governor Race

description: Republican Donald Trump defeated Democrat Kamala Harris in Florida, according to Fox, NBC and CNN.
title: Trump Wins Florida, State He Carried in Both 2016 and 2020

description: Florida Senator Rick Scott won election to a second term, fending off Democratic challenger who sought to break Republicans’ hold on the state.
title: Republican Senator Rick Scott Wins Reelection in Florida

description: Democrat Andy Kim defeated Republican Curtis Bashaw in the New Jersey Senate race to replace former Senate Democrat Bob Menendez, according to the Associated Press.
title: Democrat Kim Wins New Jersey Senate Race

description: West Virginia Governor Jim Justice won the race to fill the Senate seat being vacated by Democrat-turned-independent Joe Manchin, flipping it to Republicans, according to the Associated Press.
title: Justice Wins West Virginia Senate Race to Flip Seat to Republicans

description: An ultra-rich American pouring tens of millions of dollars into a presidential race is nothing new. Nor is lobbying for their business interests or vying for a position in the next administration.
title: Elon Musk-Led Election Falsehoods Hang Over Vote as Tally Begins
